comments.content:
Please tell me what font this is   
   
   
Thanks!   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124203im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28620.jpg)\</font\>
I don't know what it is, but it appears to have been stretched.

That's funny. I was just playing around with Chianti GX this weekend. I never installed QuickDrawGX way back, but I remembered that MacOS X supports GX fonts. I dug up my old Bitstream Type Shop Pro CD-ROM which has a bunch of GX fonts to see how well they worked and whether you can access the extra glyphs in Illustrator CS. You can, but only through the Glyph Palette, and some of glyphs are a bit garbled. TextEdit and other Cocoa applications support them completely, though.   
   
Anyway, I don't think the font in question is Chianti, but, you're right, it's very close.
